#Text=Ahmedi of Iran 's PDKI discusses Kurdistan 's general strike and the democratic future of Iran
#Text=Wednesday , July 15 , 2009
#Text=Ethnoreligious map of Iran
#Text=Unrest in Iran following the 2009 Iranian presidential election has now continued for over a month .

#Text=Despite the focus of international attention on continued demonstrations against the Ahmedinejad government , an ongoing press blackout means little of the news , which does arrive from Iran , comes from the provinces which are home to 74 % of Iran 's population .
#Text=On July 13 , unconfirmed reports began to emerge of a general strike in the four largely- Kurdish provinces in the north-west of Iran which make up Iranian Kurdistan .
#Text=Videos showed empty , deserted streets and shuttered shops in Mahabad , Saghez and other Kordestani cities .
#Text=The reports of the strike coincide with the twentieth anniversary of the murder of Abdul Rahman Ghassemlou , the leader of the Kurdistan Democratic Party of Iran ( PDKI ) .
#Text=Loghman Ahmedi , a Kurdish exile and the PDKI 's representative to the United Kingdom , spoke with Wikinews .

#Text=It seems like often , discussion of the politics in Kurdistan , whether in Iran , Iraq or Turkey , is dominated by discussion of communist or guerilla groups like the Kurdistan Workers ' Party ( PKK ) or the Communist Party of Iran .
#Text=Do you think moderate , western-style democratic groups are shut out of the conversation in the international media , and if so , why ?
#Text=What is PDKI 's place in the conversation within Iranian Kurdistan ?
#Text=Different organisations use different methods to raise awareness about issues they regard as important .
#Text=Naturally , international media outlets give attention to more militant actions .

#Text=The Democratic Party of Iranian Kurdistan is the oldest Kurdish political party in all four parts of Kurdistan and the most experienced political organisation in Iranian Kurdistan ; we have in the past waged a guerrilla war against the Islamic Republic from 1979 to 1997 , and although we are not rejecting armed struggle as a method , we think that there are other opportunities that are less costly in terms of human lives that are worth pursuing .

#Text=We have always believed that it is of strategic importance to engage in different forms of political protest that are less costly in terms of human lives ; for example , in the form of general strikes and other forms civil disobedience – which we witnessed all over Iranian Kurdistan on the occasion of the 20th anniversary of the assassination of the Kurdish leader Dr. Ghassemlou on July 13 , 1989 , by the Islamic Republic in Vienna .
#Text=President of the Islamic Republic of Iran , Mahmoud Ahmadinejad
#Text=Image : Daniella Zalcman .

#Text=The PDKI is the leading Kurdish political party in Iranian Kurdistan ; in the first rounds of elections to the Majlis after the revolution , our party won an overwhelming majority of the votes in Iranian Kurdistan and our party leader at the time , Dr. Ghassemlou , was elected to the Council of Experts , which had the task of drafting the constitution , as the only secular member .

#Text=During the past 63 years , and in particular during the past 30 years , we have shown that we act in the interest of our people and as a consequence of that our party is popular and respected by the Kurdish people .

#Text=Thus , even though we think it is important that international media pays attention to the situation in Iranian Kurdistan , for us it is more important to engage in forms of political activity that are of long-term significance .

#Text=It should also be mentioned that the general strike on July 13 did not receive any attention by international media for the simple reason that the Islamic Republic has created a North Korea -like situation in Iranian Kurdistan where not only international media cannot gain access to the region , but it is also difficult for the Kurds themselves to inform the outside world about their plight .
